discreteActionWrapper.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 import gym
2 from gym import spaces
3 import gym_jointcontrol
4 
5 class jointcontrolDiscrete(gym.Wrapper):
6  """!@brief Class wrapping the jointcontrol gym environment to have a discrete action space, enabling usage of more RL algorithms """
7  def __init__(self, env, discretisation=0.5) -> None:
8  """
9  Class constructor
10 
11  Action space discretisation is set using the discretisation parameter.
12  Since discretisation is applied to the scaled action-input,
13  the real level of discretisation will be different for each param, depending on the specified maximum change.
14  The actual discretisation for each controller parameter can be calculated by:
15 
16  realDiscretisation = discretisation*MaxChange
17 
18  Only the step() method is implemented, because other methods of the jointcontrol env are unaffected by a changed action space.
19  """
20  # Inherit from original env and store discretisation level
21  super().__init__(env)
22  self.env = env
23  self.discretisation = discretisation
24  # Set up action space as discrete
25  # Possible actions include incrementing and decrementing each param
26  self.numParams = len(self.env.jointParams["Defaults"])
27  self.action_space = spaces.Discrete(self.numParams*2)
28 
29  def step(self, action):
30  """
31  Performs env.step(), but with discrete actions.
32 
33  Actions are decoded like this:
34  1 -> increment param 1
35  2 -> decrement param 1
36  3 -> increment param 2
37  4 -> decrement param 2
38  ...
39  """
40  # Make sure inputted action is valid and can be decoded
41  assert action < self.numParams*2
42  # Create list of param changes based on discretisation and param size
43  if action%2 == 0: tmp = self.discretisation
44  else: tmp = -self.discretisation
45  actionList = [ 0 for _ in range(self.numParams) ]
46  actionList[int(action/2)] = tmp
47  # Perform step in non-discrete env and return observation
48  return self.env.step(actionList)
